author: Staff Reporter
text:
2,979 visually challenged voters in district

A Braille handbook on voter awareness, meant for visually challenged people was released here on Monday.

District Collector-cum-District Election Officer A.Gnanasekaran distributed the handbook prepared by the Election Commission of India to the visually challenged voters in the district.

The handbook educates visually-challenged people on how to register themselves as voters and how to cast their votes.

There are 3,499 visually challenged people in the district, of whom 2,979 are above 18 years of age. Mr.Gnanasekaran insisted that they all should fulfil their democratic duty by casting their vote and contribute to realise 100 per cent polling in the district during the Assembly election 2016. Those eligible to be registered as voters should go through the handbook and register themselves as voters, he said.

Motorcycle rally

Earlier, Mr.Gnanasekaran flagged off a motorcycle campaign of Village Administrative Officers and Revenue Inspectors to spread awareness on voting, which will cover the villages in Tiruvannamalai assembly constituency which voted poorly in past elections.

District Revenue Officer S.Palani and Revenue Divisional Officer R.Uma Maheswari, Tahsildars Gopu (Election), Panneerselvam (Tiruvannamalai) were among those who participated.
title: Braille voter awareness handbook released
